intro: Diosma bisulca, commonly known as the slender diosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Diosma bisulca typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
